Reviews.Title: Better than you might think
Reviews.Author: Grandpa Bill "gnostic but nice"
Reviews.Content: This phone is being discontinued.  Why?  Could it be because it is the only cellphone I have had since 1996 that has outlived the battery?  Tough little bugger.  Made a mistake of buying a smartphone and really like this simple one much better.  Most people think the keyboard is too small, but I find it very easy to use.  Not real good for web/Internet, but I still use my laptop for most of that anyway.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: gooselady0720
Reviews.Content: I had the Samsung Dart- Worst battery life ever.  I backtracked to this phone.  It is the best phone I've ever had. Not an android though. very easy to use and clear screen and never dropped a call no matter where I am at. It has lots of features that I like. I bought it used and have used it over a year and it's still going strong. the alarm is a good feature also.you can play some java games with it and I can get online with the web to go but its not fast or easy- takes patience but it's not an android. It's called a "Smiley" cause it will make you smile instead of making you cuss at it like the Samsung Dart I had. If you are looking for a good non android this is the "one " to get.

Reviews.Title: Hard to find a good "Not-a-Touch" phone
Reviews.Author: Diane Wendt "alwayz readn"
Reviews.Content: I've shunned touch phones due to a medical condition that has my hands shaking sometimes. In this day and age it is becomming harder and harder to find a good, "old-fashioned" cell phone. This phone is NOT old-fashioned in any way except not being touch or supporting 4G. For quality, Samsung is definately my choice in cell phone (also TV and BlueRay dvd player). As to the "T-Moble prepaid" aspect of this phone, I just put my own SIM chip in it instead of the one provided. The only negative I have to say is that I seem to be charging it more often than my old one, but that's a negative comment on the battery, not the phone itself. On the up side, my 6-year-old grandson does not ask to borrow it to play games on when he's bored . . ."you know, grandma, it doesn't DO anything!" when he touches the screen. Again proving one man's trash is another man's treasure.

Reviews.Title: Samsung T359 ( T Mobile)
Reviews.Author: Sim Chhay
Reviews.Content: I like this phone so much: small ,Very nice,clear screen,long battery,clear sound,easy to use.I don't use internet with this phone.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: T.Thompson
Reviews.Content: I love it and it was in perfect condition when I received it and price was right. I would purchase more items.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Smiley cell phone
Reviews.Author: Queen Nesae "Queen Nesae"
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for four years! I have never had a problem with it! It has been dropped countless times and still performs like a champ. This phone is good for talk, texting, occasional pictures if u want, also u can record. I refuse to get an over-priced phone when this phone does all I need it to do. It is time to replace it because I literally have tape holding the back on, and it no longr says samsung, its faded, lol. it still works perfectly, is just an eyesore now. P.S. I have never replaced the battery.

Reviews.Title: Good price
Reviews.Author: Minerva
Reviews.Content: It's a great phone for the price. I do find the keyboard a little small and makes it difficult for me to type fast, but its a good choice for someone who doesn't mind a simple phone

Reviews.Title: skully smiley
Reviews.Author: B. McMillan "Fifi"
Reviews.Content: We received this phone in excellent condition and quickly.. the smiley is just a basic phone w/out all the bells and whistles and is not 'smart'. I have a pay as you go plan and I don't want to use all of my minutes playing on my phone. This is an excellent phone for texting and you can access the net if you really want to. I'm very satisfied with it. As with any new phone you have to read the book and try each thing to get to know all of things it does. Great Deal !!

Reviews.Title: t359
Reviews.Author: daniel s shepard
Reviews.Content: Good features reliable picks up weak T-Mobile signal where I'm at. Would recommend it to anyone who wants a basic feature phone without all the bells and whistles of more expensive smartphones.

Reviews.Title: Keypad is very small.
Reviews.Author: wendy betthauser
Reviews.Content: The touch keys are so small I need to put on reading glasses to see the numbers.  I was very disappointed but will keep trying to use the phone.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: LHT
Reviews.Content: This is a great little inexpensive phone with a keyboard.  the screen is a little small but works fine.  The ability of the camera is much better than i expected.

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: dhuizar
Reviews.Content: My husband loved his new phone! My only complaint... I wish it had come with an sd card.. Not much memory without.

Reviews.Title: great phone easy to use
Reviews.Author: jeff
Reviews.Content: I previously had this phone allready (accidentally put it through the washing machine). If your like me and only use a phone for talking and texting then it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: I Love this phone
Reviews.Author: rhonda rivera
Reviews.Content: This is the best phone ever. Not fancy like the smart phones but I just love it.. Would recommend this

Reviews.Title: t-mobile 359
Reviews.Author: MICHELLE
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with the phone was in better shape than my old one so I was very happy! yeaaa

Reviews.Title: Good, Not GREAT !!!
Reviews.Author: Robin Williams
Reviews.Content: Slider on phone is loose, therefor causes connection problems and dropped calls.Other than that, I like this phone, I am a senior with memory problems and it allows me to text. I cannot not text on any other phone.I cannot "learn" the new touch screens !  I have had 3 of these phones, but it usually takes a lot of use before the slider becomes loose ?

Reviews.Title: Very Decent Phone
Reviews.Author: Lady Lena
Reviews.Content: What I like: The phone is on the adorable side.  It has everything I need - text and calling obviously, email, a camera, a multi-alarm, a calendar with reminders, you can access the web, you can review your web browsing history, and you can bookmark pages.  The phone is very durable - which is why I got it, in the hopes that it would be.  I thought the small keys would be a problem; however, I have gotten use to them which I find amazing.  There's a visual voicemail option I like - instead of calling your voicemail, you can set-up the phone like a media player with the recording information (date/time/length) displayed along with play, pause, etc. buttons; it's very convenient.  The envelope button on the far left of the phone can be programmed directly to a folder of your choice.  Mine goes to my text messages inbox.  I like the instant emoticon button on the keypad.  Lastly, it comes with great features, such as Google Maps, Tasks, Memo, reg. calc., tip calc., world clock, converter, timer, stopwatch, and an RSS reader (I haven't used the last feature).What I don't care for: This phone does not group text messages together in a conversation...which is very annoying to me.  I believe you can only have about 75 or so text messages in your inbox at a time before your phone informs you the inbox is full and asks you if you want to delete ALL of your messages.  You can say no (to select which ones you'd like to delete) but the message will repeatedly - like every 10 seconds - pop up until you lower the number of messages in your inbox.  Deleting messages in your outbox has no bearing on the messages in the inbox seemingly.  The phone randomly let's you know you don't have any new emails - which is annoying to me.  You can lock the phone; however, you cannot control how long it will take or not take for the phone to do so.  You cannot delete ANY of the games provided  and ALL of them are trial versions only; to purchase them they cost $3 and up which is ridiculous in my opinion.  Accessing the web can be a bit slow...about 13 seconds or so.  I do not like the TeleNav GPS feature.If the games set-up and alert for the full inbox were different, I would have given this phone 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: perfecet phone for non android users
Reviews.Author: Young Lou
Reviews.Content: This phone has blackberry similarities but its only 3G. This is a good phone for people who do not want to get caught up in the android rat race. Its simple of enough to use and technologically capable to do web surfing and other hi tech things.

Reviews.Title: It's okay
Reviews.Author: Barry.S
Reviews.Content: Reception is adequate. Buttons are a little small but not too bad. Had a problem with the phone, took out the battery and put it back in and it's been much better since then. No recommendation either way.

Reviews.Title: Horrible phone.
Reviews.Author: ahc26
Reviews.Content: I have been using this phone for 2 years. I couldn t afford to replace it, although i hate it.I am surprised to see that it is still for sale. And so expensiv: $89.00 for this crap? It s insaneDo not buy this phone. I was so disappointed with it, to the point that i don t want to hear about any Samsung item anymore.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: Books4Life
Reviews.Content: This was pre-used, which was not clear from the description, but came packaged as if it was new.  When I took it into T-Mobile they told me it was probably stolen, and definitely defective.  Safer to get something from your local retailer.  Stay far away from this thing!

Reviews.Title: please. keep making those basic cell phones. please. I dont want to let t-mobile go. thank you
Reviews.Author: janie
Reviews.Content: I love my smiley.  Keep making them. And saling it. Please, please. Keep saling basic cell phone. Not only touch cell phone. Basic cell phone too. Janie (San Juanita). Thank you

ProductInfo.Features:
Slide-up vertical QWERTY keyboard and dedicated shortcuts to messaging and social networks
Compatible with T-Mobile's 3G network for fast downloads.
1.3MP camera; Bluetooth; microSD memory expansion to 16 GB; organizer tools; personal & work e-mail
Up to 6 h of talk time, up to 456 h (19 days) of standby time
ProductInfo.Name: T-Mobile - Prepaid Samsung T359 Mobile Phone - Blue
